stem: Given question: James constructed a playroom for his children.   His place was small, so he put it in an unattached what? and answer: building, explain why in
no_more_50_words: James' house wasn't large enough for him to subdivide an existing room to serve as a playroom. To have enough room, he had to construct the playroom in a different, unattached building, like a garage.
50_to_100_words: James constructed a playroom for his children in an unattached building because his main residence was small and he did not have enough space for the playroom inside. An unattached building, such as a shed or a small outbuilding, can provide additional space for a playroom without taking up valuable square footage in the main living area of the house. Additionally, an unattached building can provide more privacy and separation between the playroom and the rest of the house.
